SEARCH
Package ca.ualberta.compileorcry.features.mood.model

Class MoodEvent

java.lang.Object
ca.ualberta.compileorcry.features.mood.model.MoodEvent
public class MoodEvent extends Object
The MoodEvent class represents a single mood event entry in the application. It encapsulates all data associated with a user's recorded mood, including emotional state, timestamp, location, and contextual information. Each mood event contains: - A unique identifier - Timestamp when the mood was recorded - Required emotional state (from EmotionalState enum) - Requred boolean to determine if the moodEvent is public - Optional trigger text explanation (reason for the mood) - Optional social situation context - Optional location data as GeoHash - Optional photograph (not fully implemented) Outstanding issues: - Picture data handling is not fully implemented (marked with TODO) - Location data handling needs further implementation

  • Constructor Details

    • MoodEvent

      public MoodEvent(EmotionalState emotionalState, com.google.firebase.Timestamp date, String trigger, String socialSituation, String picture, Boolean isPublic)
      Constructs a new MoodEvent with the specified emotional state and optional context information. Creates a unique ID and sets the current timestamp.
      Parameters:
      emotionalState - The emotional state for this event. Cannot be null.
      trigger - Optional text description explaining the reason for this mood event.
      socialSituation - Optional description of the social context (alone, with one person, etc).
      picture - Optional reference to an image stored in Firebase Storage.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If emotionalState is null.

    • MoodEvent

      public MoodEvent(EmotionalState emotionalState, com.google.firebase.Timestamp date, String trigger, String socialSituation, String picture, Boolean isPublic, com.firebase.geofire.core.GeoHash location)

    • MoodEvent

      public MoodEvent(String id)
      Constructs a MoodEvent with only an ID. This constructor is primarily used when reconstructing MoodEvent objects from database records where other properties will be set individually.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for this mood event

      public String getFormattedDate()
      Returns the formatted date string for display purposes.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the timestamp in "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm" format.

    • getComments

      public ArrayList<Comment> getComments(String moodUsername) throws InterruptedException
      Call for getting the comments of a moodEvent. Check if the return is null as a timeout will return false Runs synchronously so no need for callbacks. The moodUsername is needed if you're using a personal query as they do not have username. Note that this does not implement a snapshot listener and thus does not update in realtime. Use reloadComments(java.lang.String) to ensure comments are up to date.
      Parameters:
      moodUsername - Use to pass in the username of MoodEvent
      Returns:
      Returns the list of Commons
      Throws:
      RuntimeException
      InterruptedException

    • addComment

      public void addComment(Comment toAdd, MoodEvent.AddCommentCallback callback, String username)
      Method for adding comments to a moodEvent Unlike get comments this is not synchronous and requires a callback so you can handle if it fails. The username of a moodEvent can be null if it's from a personal query.
      Parameters:
      toAdd - the comment to be added
      callback - a listener for success or failure of the addition
      username - optional username for if the moodEvent has a null username

    • reloadComments

      public void reloadComments(String username) throws InterruptedException
      Use this is you want to reload the comments.
      Parameters:
      username - The moodEvent username if its null
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • containsComment

      public boolean containsComment(Comment comment)
      See if a comment with the same ID as the comment is passed in exist. Note that Comments from different MoodEvents can share the same ID. This is intended for internal use but I've left it public if someone finds use of it.
      Parameters:
      comment - The comment to check if it's contained in the MoodList
      Returns:
      Returns true if the moodList contains the comment and false if not, the ID is the comparison

    • hasComments

      public String hasComments(String username) throws InterruptedException
      Use this to see if a MoodEvent has comments
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the comment owner, will be overwritten if the parent event has a username
      Returns:
      Returns a string, either "yes","no","null","failed", yes is an afirmation that the moodEvent has comments
      Throws:
      InterruptedException
